q: Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. "For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center," said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri. "This country is not ready for a pure progressive.
